Ultrasound

Ultrasound is sound frequency too high to be audible by humans (>20kHz). Higher frequency means shorter wavelength , which means higher resolution but less penetration. Ultrasound is generated by piezoelectric crystals which vibrate when a voltage is put across them. The same crystals convert the reflected sound waves into a votage signal. (Ultrasound probes transmit for about 1Î¼sec and then receive for about 1msec.)

Two pieces of information are extracted from the wave:

  1. The time delay before the reflected wave is detected - this depends on the distance travelled

  2. The intensity of the wave - this depends on the echo-reflectivity of the tissue.
